text:
This track takes place when: 

INCOMING SPOILERS LIKELY

On the second (and after) playthrough(s), just before reviving Kaine from her petrified state, you delve into a text-based diary of her memories and life. Most of it speaks about her Grandma, the only person who truly accepted her at the time, and this track plays for most of the text section.

author: Jonathan De La Cruz

text: And if you had actually played the game you would know that it isn't any worse than the generic rehashed CoD shit Activision pushes out every year, where the only "gameplay" that changes is which pallet swapped gun you shoot with. What makes this game stand out is the story, characters, and soundtrack that are a good deal better than reviewers give them credit for. The game is 20$ at most, go figure it out for yourself or stop trying to pretend your opinions are valid if you haven't played it.

author: Humaki01

text:
@DjShini It really is a great game. A very (very) unpolished game, mind, but there are a lot of great ideas at work. The soundtrack is pretty much my favorite soundtrack to date, and the story is brilliant. Very tragic; after beating the game, I pretty much just wanted to go to sleep and never wake up again.

But yeah, HIGHLY recommended game. If you understand Japanese, I recommend Replicant over Gestalt, but both are great and worth the money.
author: Ando

text: It's like sitting ontop of a hill, watching a city slowly being engulfed by a terrible explosion from a distance. Everything happening so slowly -- such great chaos shouldn't have to be seen for even a second. Your eyes cannot retreat from the loss that had eaten a whole into this once prospering city to fill the voids of those mindless monsters that want more than this world, and it's beauty..
author: Schmidt Herman

text: I saw one gameplay vid of this awhile back and forgot about it. After hearing this track and seeing the comments, I'm actually really interested to give it a shot. I get the feeling this is an incredibly dark game with tragedy written all over it...and I'm pretty drawn to that. I LOVE stories wrought with emotion :)

author: heyjeySigma

text:
@SupraDarky Glad to see you finally adding Nier stuff. Probably one of my favourite OSTs. The Ultimate Weapon, The Wretched Automatons, Temple of the Drifting Sands and Repose are definitely my favourite songs on it. This particular song is great in how it's used, too. Not your average boss theme.

Hope you enjoy the game as much as I did. The more you let yourself think about the game and get immersed, the better it becomes despite so-so gameplay. Definitely one of my favourite games now.

text:
Pretty good game, but just letting you know, the music is the best thing about it. The gameplay is a little repetative, and feels like it could've been expanded upon, and the tutorials are annoying. (You'll see what i mean -_-) The story is very good however, but will require mutiple playthroughs to get a omniscient perspective.
Overall, it's a good game that with some minor tweaks, could've been a great game.

author: Mitch D.

text:
As I already said, the vocal tracks in this game are made to sound like real languages. For this particular song, it's based off french. Since I understand french, it's a pretty weird feeling (you can check out #695 to hear one based off english).

This song feels quite emotional. I actually bought this game not too long ago so I'm looking forward to playing it. Temple of Drifting Sands is probably my favorite track.
